newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: POSCO body sees steel sales recovering.
newsitem.headline: POSCO body sees steel sales recovering.

text.p: The research arm of Pohang Iron and Steel Co (POSCO) said on Wednesday South Korea's steel products sales were expected to recover from a slump in the second half of this year.
The POSCO Research Institute said in a report the nation's steel products sales in the second half were expected to grow by seven percent year-on-year to 24.86 million tonnes.
During the first half, the nation's steel products sales were estimated to fall by 2.4 percent to 23.29 million tonnes from 23.86 million a year earlier.
The recovery would be attributed to a recovery in domestic sales in line with improving demand, mainly from the construction sector, the report said.
Domestic sales in the second half were predicted to rise by 5.3 percent to 19 million tonnes and exports by 14.3 percent to 5.86 million.
In the first half, domestic sales were projected to fall by 7.3 percent year-on-year to 18.11 million tonnes while exports were estimated to grow by 19.4 percent to 5.17 million.
